course_info:
PHY203: ELEMENTARY PHYSICS I (Fall 2024)
Instructor: Miquel Dorca
Office: 211 East Hall
Email: miquel@uri.edu
Office Hours: MWF 12:30pm -1:00pm
Lecture Times: MWF 1:00pm-1:50pm (Section 1)
Location: East Hall Auditorium
Course Description: Calculus-based introduction to Newtonian mechanics. Topics include kinematics and dynamics of particles and systems of particles, conservation laws, rotational motion, gravitation, and oscillatory motion.
Prerequisites: Credit or concurrent enrollment in MTH 141 and concurrent enrollment in PHY 273.
Intended for: Science and engineering majors.
Textbook: University Physics (OpenStax), 1st Edition, Volume 1. Available at https://openstax.org/subjects/science.
Brightspace: Used for class announcements and lecture postings. Remote lectures scheduled for November 25th, 27th, December 2nd if needed.
schedule:
Lecture Times: MWF 1:00pm-1:50pm (Section 1) in East Hall Auditorium.
Lab Sessions: PHY273 Laboratory Schedule includes experiments from Sept 9 to Dec 6 with specific dates for each experiment.
Recitation: Held in Room 112. Recitation sections must be registered separately.
Special Remote Lecture Dates: November 25th, 27th, December 2nd on Brightspace.
Final Exam: Date TBA.
assignments:
Homework Assignments: Due on or before Wednesdays or Fridays by 10:00pm each week via WebAssign. Specific due dates include:
- HW #1: Wed., Sept. 11
- HW #2: Wed., Sept. 18
- HW #3: Fri., Sept. 25
- HW #4: Fri., Oct. 4
- HW #5: Fri., Oct. 18
- HW #6: Fri., Oct. 25
- HW #7: Fri., Oct. 25
- HW #8: Wed., Nov. 6
- HW #9: Wed., Nov. 20
- HW #10: Wed., Dec. 4
- HW #11: Wed., Dec. 11
- HW #12: Wed., Dec. 11
exams:
Unit Exams:
- Exam #1: Chaps. 1,3,4 on Fri., Sep. 27
- Exam #2: Chaps. 5-8 on Fri., Oct. 25
- Exam #3: Chaps. 9-11,15 on Wed., Dec. 11
Final Exam: Comprehensive covering Chaps. 1-11,15, date TBA
All exams are closed book. Calculators permitted. Formula sheets allowed: 1 sheet for unit exams, 3 sheets for the final.
Note: Exam schedule may be modified if the course goes remote.
readings:
Reading Assignments aligned with homework:
- HW #1: Chapter 1
- HW #2: Sections 3.1-3.5
- HW #3: Sections 2.1-2.3, 4.1-4.3
- HW #4: Chapter 5
- HW #5: Sections 4.4, 6.1-6.3
- HW #6: 1st part of Sec. 2.4, Chapter 7
- HW #7: Chapter 8
- HW #8: Sections 9.1-9.6
- HW #9: 2nd part of Sec. 2.4, Sections 11-11.3
- HW #10: Sections 13.1-13.5
- HW #11 & HW #12: Sections 15.1, 15.2, 15.4
special_sessions:
Recitation Sessions: Held in Room 112. Must register separately. Recitation grade up to 250 points based on solving 3 problems per session.
Laboratory Sessions: PHY273 Laboratory includes seven experiments scheduled from Sept 9 to Dec 6. Labs held in designated lab sections with make-up lab available on Dec 12 (Reading Day).
Remote Lectures: If the course goes remote due to weather or other cancellations, lectures will be available asynchronously on Brightspace on November 25th, 27th, and December 2nd.
